name: Error Detection (Basic)
description: Find and identify errors in presented content by clicking on them

content.description: The text containing errors for the student to find

contentLanguage.description: Language of the content (for audio support)

contentAudio.description: Audio file path for content (language learning)

errors.description: Array of errors in the content (empty array for 'no errors' tasks)

errorText.description: The incorrect text to find (can be multi-word phrase)

errorType.description: Type of error (for content authors, not shown to users)

position.description: Character index for handling duplicate errorText (optional)

showErrorCount.description: Whether to show 'Find X errors' instruction

hint.description: Manual hint text for the student

examples.content: The capital of Australia is Sydney. It was founded in 1888.
examples.explanation: Canberra is the capital of Australia, and it was founded in 1913. Sydney is the largest city but not the capital.
examples.hint: Look for geographical and historical errors.

examples.content: The Statue of Liberty is located in Los Angeles. It was a gift from England.
examples.hint: Check the location and origin of the statue.
